means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯沃洛绰号，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“燕子”(swallow)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯旺职业名称，仆人或侍从，见Swain↑1

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"吃"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: eat, dine, have, consume, devour, gorge, swallow
means: eat ： 普通用词，使用广泛。既可用于人，也可用于动物。
dine ： 正式用词，既可指一日三餐中的任何一餐，也可以指特殊的用餐。
have ： 可与eat换用，但强调一次性的动作。
consume ： 侧重痛痛快快地吃得一干二净，可用于人和动物。
devour ： 指狼吞虎咽地吃，强调吃得既快又彻底。
gorge ： 侧重指拼命地吃或塞，强调吃饱或吃得过量。
swallow ： 主要指吃的整个过程的第二部分"咽"，并常指咀嚼得匆匆忙忙地吃。

sentence.Network_en: I too found this story a little hard to swallow.
sentence.Network_cn: 我也觉得这件事有点难以置信。

sentence.Network_en: Did you ever swallow the conspiracy theory about Kennedy?
sentence.Network_cn: 你有没有轻信过有关肯尼迪总统遇刺的阴谋论？

sentence.Network_en: You are asked to swallow a capsule containing vitamin B.
sentence.Network_cn: 你要服一粒维生素B胶囊。

phrase.cizu_name: one swallow does not make a summer

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)a single fortunate event doesn't mean that what follows will also be good
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)一燕不成夏（一次走运并不代表后来也都是好运）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English swelgan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zwelgen and German schwelgen
Old English swealwe, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zwaluw and German Schwalbe

entry.def: If you swallow something, you cause it to go from your mouth down into your stomach.

example.ex: You are asked to swallow a capsule containing vitamin B...
example.tran: 你要服一粒维生素 B 胶囊。

example.ex: Polly took a bite of the apple, chewed and swallowed.
example.tran: 波利咬了一口苹果，嚼了嚼咽了下去。

entry.tran: (常因为紧张或恐惧而)做吞咽动作，咽口水
entry.def: If you swallow, you make a movement in your throat as if you are swallowing something, often because you are nervous or frightened.

example.ex: Nancy swallowed hard and shook her head.
example.tran: 南希用力咽了口口水，摇了摇头。

entry.def: If someone swallows a story or a statement, they believe it completely.

example.ex: It was vital that he swallowed the story about Juanita being in that motel room that night.
example.tran: 关键是他对朱厄妮塔那晚住在那个汽车旅馆房间里一事毫不怀疑。

example.ex: I too found this story a little hard to swallow.
example.tran: 我也觉得这件事有点难以置信。

entry.def: If you swallow your feelings, you do not express them, although you want to very much.

example.ex: Gordon has swallowed the anger he felt...
example.tran: 戈登忍住了内心的愤怒。

example.ex: He flashed me a quick grin but rapidly swallowed it when he saw my expression.
example.tran: 他先是冲我咧嘴一笑，不过看到我的表情后又赶紧收起笑脸。

entry.def: A swallow is a kind of small bird with pointed wings and a forked tail.

means.word_mean: 1. a small amount of liquid food;

sentences.sentence: "one swallow of the liquid was enough"
"he took a drink of his beer and smacked his lips"

means.word_mean: 3. small long-winged songbird noted for swift graceful flight and the regularity of its migrations
1. pass through the esophagus as part of eating or drinking;

sentences.sentence: "Swallow the raw fish--it won't kill you!"

means.word_mean: 3. enclose or envelop completely, as if by swallowing;

sentences.sentence: "The huge waves swallowed the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter"
"She swallowed the last words of her speech"

means.word_mean: 5. take back what one has said;

sentences.sentence: "I swallowed my anger and kept quiet"
"I shall have to accept these unpleasant working conditions"
"She has learned to live with her husband's little idiosyncracies"

means.word_mean: 8. believe or accept without questioning or challenge;

sentences.sentence: "Am I supposed to swallow that story?"

auth_sentence.content: My mouth dried up and I couldn't swallow.
auth_sentence.res_content: My mouth dried up and I couldn't swallow.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My mouth dried up and I couldn't swallow.

auth_sentence.content: They swallow their prey whole, in one gulp.
auth_sentence.res_content: They swallow their prey whole, in one gulp.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They swallow their prey whole, in one gulp.

auth_sentence.content: They swallow the rest of it without tasting it.
auth_sentence.res_content: They swallow the rest of it without tasting it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They swallow the rest of it without tasting it.

Sentence.sentence: If we don't, we will be swallowed up by one of the giants.

sentences.cn: 他未经咀嚼就把食物咽下。

sentences.en: He put a grape into his mouth and swallowed it whole.
sentences.cn: 他把一粒葡萄放入嘴里, 整个吞了下去。

sentences.en: I don't know how I managed to swallow my anger.
sentences.cn: 我不知道怎样才能抑制住我的愤怒。

sentences.en: He was forced to swallow his pride and ask for money from his brother.
sentences.cn: 他不得不抛下面子, 从他弟弟那里求得资助。

sentences.en: I found it hard to swallow his insults.
sentences.cn: 我真的很难忍受他的侮辱。

sentences.en: He had a few swallows of tea and then hurried out.
sentences.cn: 他喝了几口茶, 就匆忙出去了。燕子

sentences.en: One swallow doesn't make a summer.

jushi.english: He swallowed hard and turned to face his accuser.
jushi.chinese: 他强忍下去,转身面对挖苦他的人。

jushi.english: His throat was so painful that he could hardly swallow.
jushi.chinese: 他的嗓子疼,几乎咽不下东西。
